title: COVID-19 Vaccine | Howard County
cleaned_text: Get Vaccinated Vaccinations are FREE and available for all Marylanders age 6 months and older. Anyone who is part of an eligible age group can register for a vaccine using the links below or at many pharmacies or medical providers. [Health Department Vaccination Clinics](#health-department-vaccination-clinics) [Maryland Vaccination Site Locator](https://www.vaccines.gov/) [Locating Your Official Vaccination Records](#locating-your-official-vaccination-records) Questions? Contact our COVID-19 Hotline. If you have a question about COVID-19, please call our COVID-19 Hotline, available Monday through Friday, 8:30 am - 4:30 pm. Moderna, Pfizer Updated (Bivalent) Booster Shot Recommendations According to the latest guidance from the FDA and CDC in April 2023: [Everyone aged 6 years and older](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fvaccines%2Fbooster-shot.html#everyone-6-and-older)should get 1 updated Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna COVID-19 vaccine to be considered [up to date](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fvaccines%2Fbooster-shot.html#up-to-date). [People aged 65 years and older](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fvaccines%2Fbooster-shot.html#additional-booster)may get a 2nd updated Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna COVID-19 booster dose. [People who are moderately or severely immunocompromised](https://www.cdc.gov/vaccines/covid-19/clinical-considerations/interim-considerations-us.html#immunocompromised)may get additional updated Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna COVID-19 booster doses. [Children aged 6 months-5 years](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fvaccines%2Fbooster-shot.html#children-5-and-under)may need multiple doses of COVID-19 vaccine to be [up to date](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fvaccines%2Fbooster-shot.html#up-to-date), including at least 1 updated dose of Pfizer-BioNTech or Moderna COVID-19 vaccine, depending on the number of doses they've previously received and their age. Howard County Health Department offers a wide variety of vaccination options. Appointments are available using the [calendar below](https://www.howardcountymd.gov/health/covid-19-vaccine#health-department-vaccination-clinics). Please note the vaccine type and age range before making an appointment. Vaccine is also available at local pharmacies, urgent care centers, and retail stores. You can visit the [Maryland Vaccine Locater](https://www.vaccines.gov/) to find a vaccination location convenient to you. Stay Up-to-Date with COVID-19 Vaccines Unsure whether you are up-to-date with your COVID boosters? [Click here for CDC guidance](https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/vaccines/stay-up-to-date.html). If you believe you are moderately or severely immunocompromised, contact your healthcare provider for specific guidance. Health Department Vaccination Clinics *Online pre-registration is not currently available. Please call 410-313-6284 to register for a vaccine appointment. Important Information: - If you are unable to complete the online registration or have additional questions about the COVID-19 vaccine, call 410-313-6284. Operators are standing by Monday - Friday from 8:30am - 4:30pm. - Please note the vaccine type and age range for a designated clinic before making your appointment. For infant/toddler vaccination, [click here.](https://www.howardcountymd.gov/health/pediatric-covid-19-vaccine) - We no longer offer the Novavax vaccine as a primary series for those ages 12+. We will continue to offer the Pfizer and Moderna bivalent vaccines as a primary series for everyone ages 6 months and older. - Anyone receiving a booster vaccine shot should bring their vaccine card or other proof of vaccination to verify the date of vaccination. - Azova Saliva PCR tests are offered at many Health Department COVID-19 vaccine clinics. One take home test kit per person, per appointment. Testing kits are not available at clinics hosted by other organizations. Find more information about Azova saliva PCR testing and make your appointment [here](https://www.howardcountymd.gov/health/covid-19-testing#health-department-testing). Please note: This fall, a new COVID-19 vaccine formulation is due to be released. The new formulation will provide improved protection for the current circulating COVID-19 disease. We want to ensure that everyone is protected as fully as possible. Talk to your medical provider about when and which COVID-19 vaccine is best for your circumstances.
